metadata.title: E-health in the East Asian tigers

abstract.original_text: Objective: The article analyzes e-health progress in East Asia's leading tiger economies: Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore, South Korea and Taiwan. It describes five main dimensions of e-health provision in the tigers: policymaking, regulation, provision, funding and physician-patient relations. Methods: We conducted a series of fieldwork interviews and analyzed key healthcare websites.

sentences.segment_text: Objective : The article analyzes e-health progress in East Asia 's leading tiger economies : Japan ,
Hong Kong , Singapore , South Korea and Taiwan .
It describes five main dimensions of e-health provision in the tigers : policymaking ,
regulation , provision , funding and physician-patient relations .
Methods : We conducted a series of fieldwork interviews and analyzed key healthcare websites .

abstract.original_text: Our main finding is that the development of e-health in the region is less advanced than might be expected. Our explanation focuses on institutional, cultural and financial factors.

sentences.segment_text: Our main finding is that the development of e-health in the region is less advanced than might be expected .
Our explanation focuses on institutional , cultural and financial factors .
